description: We're a modern wealth manager. There are many solutions out there for how one can invest by themselves (e.g., DIY brokerages like Robinhood). But for those who want to have their money managed, they must turn to high fee, high minimum advisors (e.g., RIAs like Edward Jones). With LLMs, we can now offer personalized wealth management to many more people, more cheaply and with faster service. Our goal is to grow their wealth more than they'd do on their own.

founders.name: Clayton Gardner, Founder
founders.description: Clay is co-founder and co-CEO of Titan. Prior to Titan, he spent six years as an investor at multi-billion dollar hedge funds and private equity firms including Goldman Sachs and Farallon Capital Management. He graduated summa cum laude from the Wharton School and School of Engineering at the University of Pennsylvania with degrees in economics and computer science.

## Frequently Asked Questions
How is Titan different?
Think of us as the natural next step when you’ve outgrown “Do It Yourself” trading and want something more sophisticated than a basic robo-advisor.
With trading apps, you’re on your own buying and selling stocks. With robo-advisors, you get a cookie-cutter ETF portfolio that never changes. Neither is ideal if you are serious about trying to grow your wealth.
We’re building what comes next. Titan actively manages your money with a team of real investment professionals at your disposal, all focused on one goal: making you more money while saving you more time. Plus, you get premium benefits you’ll actually use, like free tax filing and direct access to our investment team.
Why shouldn’t I just use the S&P 500?
We’re big fans of the S&P 500. It’s a well-rounded index of equities that has historically performed very well over a long period of time relative to other investment options. But it shouldn’t be 100% of most people’s portfolios at all times. Wealth should be personalized.
We take your personal situation into account and build you a portfolio that goes beyond just large US stocks. We mix passive and active strategies across different asset classes, and we’re tactical about when and how to invest – especially important when the S&P 500 is hitting all-time highs.
Bottom line: The S&P 500 is a great tool, but it’s just one tool. Your wealth needs a full toolbox, and that’s what we provide.
How is Titan choosing investment options for me?
We get it – finance is full of jargon, endless options, and a lot of noise. Our approach is different. We’re incredibly picky about what makes it into your portfolio because our mission is simple: growing your wealth as efficiently as possible.
We maintain a small but powerful suite of investment tools, carefully chosen by our investment team. No bloated menus of random options – just high-quality investment options at the lowest possible prices. Think of us as your investment filter, cutting through the Wall Street noise to identify what actually works.
Our analysts conduct deep research on every investment we offer, asking one simple question: How can this help grow your hard-earned money quicker and more efficiently? That’s it.
How often should I expect to chat with an advisor?
Think of us as your personal advisor team that’s always just a tap away. You’re in control of how much support you want. Major life changes on the horizon? Let’s talk them through. Just want a quick portfolio review? We can do that too.
Some of our clients love having quarterly check-ins to stay on top of their financial goals and make sure everything’s tracking right. Others might only reach out once or twice a year when they’re facing big life decisions or want to revisit their strategy. Both approaches are perfectly fine – we’re here when you need us.
How much does Titan membership cost?
Our membership is straightforward: $25/month (or $250/year if you choose annual billing). This isn’t just another fee – it’s your investment in having a team of professionals actively manage your wealth.
Titan clients have historically compounded their wealth at 11.6% per year on average. Studies show that the average DIY investor underperforms advisors and the broader market by ~3% per year. (Disclosure)
For our average client making $75/hour, we save them over $10,000 worth of time annually – time they’d otherwise spend managing their own portfolio (most DIY investors spend 3-5 hours weekly on this).
Plus, we’re about 50% cheaper than traditional private wealth managers. If you’ve invested at least $6,000 in our Smart Treasury product, the earnings from our industry-leading yield can offset your membership fee. Bottom line: if we save you just 20 minutes a month (which we consistently do), the fee has already paid for itself.
More info on pricing [here](http://www.titan.com/<https:/help.titan.com/en_us/titan-s-fees-B1lNrytB9>).
How do I know Titan is the right wealth manager for me?
Simple: If you’ve graduated from DIY trading apps and want your wealth managed by professionals who actually explain what they’re doing, we’re your team. We’re built for people who value their time and want their money working harder for them.
Think of us as your personal chief financial officer, right in your pocket. We take the complex world of wealth management and make it straightforward, active, and tailored to you. No more juggling multiple apps or trying to piece together your own investment strategy – we handle everything in one place, with one clear goal: make you more money while saving you more time.
Why do Titan clients choose us?
We’re not your typical wealth manager. We’re building what we wanted but couldn’t find – a wealth manager that combines institutional-grade investing with modern technology and real human expertise, but without the high fees and minimums usually required by other firms. You get our proprietary investment strategies (like our Flagship equity portfolio), smart cash management solutions, and on-demand access to real financial advisors who know their stuff.
But it’s more than just managing money. We’re giving you back your time and peace of mind, plus adding perks you’ll actually use – like free tax filing and access to investment opportunities typically reserved for the ultra-wealthy. We’re not just managing your wealth; we’re helping you build and enjoy it.
How secure is my money with Titan?
Let us be crystal clear about this: Your security is our absolute priority. As an SEC-registered investment adviser, Titan is legally required to act in your best interest as a fiduciary.
SIPC protects investors against the loss of [cash and securities](http://www.titan.com/<https:/www.sipc.org/for-investors/what-sipc-protects#cash>) in the event of a SIPC-member brokerage firm failure. The limit of SIPC coverage is $500,000, which includes a $250,000 limit for cash. SIPC coverage is limited and does not protect against the decline in value of your securities. For more details, visit [www.sipc.org.](http://www.titan.com/<https:/www.sipc.org/>)
Plus, we use a third-party custodian to hold client assets separately. Most importantly, you own all your underlying assets in a separately managed account - we don't hold your assets directly. We employ industry-leading encryption and cybersecurity measures to protect your data, from encryption to SAML protection, because we know we're handling your hard-earned money. That's a responsibility we take incredibly seriously.

Best Financial Advisory Firms 2023, USA Today: The ranking of the best registered investment advisory firms (“RIA Firms”) was compiled by USA Today and Statista, is based on two dimensions: recommendations by clients and peers and a firm’s growth of Assets under Management (AUM). The recommendations were collected via an independent survey sent to over 20,000 individuals. While clients were able to evaluate and recommend their RIA firm, financial advisors working for an RIA firm were asked to consider a scenario where their own firm could not take on a client and had to recommend another RIA firm they appreciate. The development of AUM was analyzed both, short and long term based on publicly available data. For the short term view, the growth of AUM over a twelve months period was calculated, from January 2022 to January 2023. For the long term view, the growth of AUM over a five year period was calculated, from 2018 to 2023. In the consideration for the top 500 RIA firms, recommendations had a weight of 20% while development of AUM had a weight of 80% (short term and long term growth were equally weighted) to derive the final score.
Top Private Y Combinator Companies, Y Combinator (2023): Inclusion in the 2023 'Top Private Y Combinator Companies' list is based on the company's valuation from its latest funding round, and all companies on the list are valued at over $150M.
Titan participated in the Y Combinator funding cycle in 2018. Y Combinator runs two three-month funding cycles a year, during which selected entrepreneurial teams are given a seed investment in exchange for a small equity stake in the company. The teams move to Silicon Valley for the duration of the cycle, during which they receive intensive mentoring and assistance in refining their business plans, developing their products, and pitching to investors. The cycle culminates in a Demo Day, during which each startup presents a quick pitch to a carefully selected, invite-only audience of investors.
Best Wealth Management Solution, Finovate (2022): The 'Best Wealth Management Solution' award is given to a wealth management firm, bank or FI with an excellent new solution to give consumers more control over their future wealth and help them meet long-term financial goals.
Fastest Growing Retail Investment Brand, Global Brands Magazine (2021): Titan's recognition as the 2021 Fastest Growing Retail Investment Brand by Global Brands Magazine is based on an evaluation process involving a nominations team, an internal research team, and an independent external research agency. Companies are proactively invited to participate, and all nominations are validated and researched for adequate data. The external research agency then scrutinizes the nominations based on various criteria and publicly available data. Final award winners are decided by the internal team based on fundamental objectives and announced on the Global Brands Magazine website.
These recognitions do not evaluate client satisfaction or predict future investment performance. They should not be construed as an endorsement of Titan by any client. Rankings and recognitions should not be construed by a client or prospective client as a guarantee that they will experience a certain level of results if Titan is engaged, or continues to be engaged, to provide investment advisory services. Nor should they be construed as a current or past endorsement of Titan.

## Frequently Asked Questions
How is Titan different?
Think of us as the natural next step when you’ve outgrown “Do It Yourself” trading and want something more sophisticated than a basic robo-advisor.
With trading apps, you’re on your own buying and selling stocks. With robo-advisors, you get a cookie-cutter ETF portfolio that never changes. Neither is ideal if you are serious about trying to grow your wealth.
We’re building what comes next. Titan actively manages your money with a team of real investment professionals at your disposal, all focused on one goal: making you more money while saving you more time. Plus, you get premium benefits you’ll actually use, like free tax filing and direct access to our investment team.
Why shouldn’t I just use the S&P 500?
We’re big fans of the S&P 500. It’s a well-rounded index of equities that has historically performed very well over a long period of time relative to other investment options. But it shouldn’t be 100% of most people’s portfolios at all times. Wealth should be personalized.
We take your personal situation into account and build you a portfolio that goes beyond just large US stocks. We mix passive and active strategies across different asset classes, and we’re tactical about when and how to invest – especially important when the S&P 500 is hitting all-time highs.
Bottom line: The S&P 500 is a great tool, but it’s just one tool. Your wealth needs a full toolbox, and that’s what we provide.
How is Titan choosing investment options for me?
We get it – finance is full of jargon, endless options, and a lot of noise. Our approach is different. We’re incredibly picky about what makes it into your portfolio because our mission is simple: growing your wealth as efficiently as possible.
We maintain a small but powerful suite of investment tools, carefully chosen by our investment team. No bloated menus of random options – just high-quality investment options at the lowest possible prices. Think of us as your investment filter, cutting through the Wall Street noise to identify what actually works.
Our analysts conduct deep research on every investment we offer, asking one simple question: How can this help grow your hard-earned money quicker and more efficiently? That’s it.
How often should I expect to chat with an advisor?
Think of us as your personal advisor team that’s always just a tap away. You’re in control of how much support you want. Major life changes on the horizon? Let’s talk them through. Just want a quick portfolio review? We can do that too.
Some of our clients love having quarterly check-ins to stay on top of their financial goals and make sure everything’s tracking right. Others might only reach out once or twice a year when they’re facing big life decisions or want to revisit their strategy. Both approaches are perfectly fine – we’re here when you need us.
How much does Titan membership cost?
Our membership is straightforward: $25/month (or $250/year if you choose annual billing). This isn’t just another fee – it’s your investment in having a team of professionals actively manage your wealth.
Titan clients have historically compounded their wealth at 11.6% per year on average. Studies show that the average DIY investor underperforms advisors and the broader market by ~3% per year. (Disclosure)
For our average client making $75/hour, we save them over $10,000 worth of time annually – time they’d otherwise spend managing their own portfolio (most DIY investors spend 3-5 hours weekly on this).
Plus, we’re about 50% cheaper than traditional private wealth managers. If you’ve invested at least $6,000 in our Smart Treasury product, the earnings from our industry-leading yield can offset your membership fee. Bottom line: if we save you just 20 minutes a month (which we consistently do), the fee has already paid for itself.
More info on pricing here⟨16⟩.
How do I know Titan is the right wealth manager for me?
Simple: If you’ve graduated from DIY trading apps and want your wealth managed by professionals who actually explain what they’re doing, we’re your team. We’re built for people who value their time and want their money working harder for them.
Think of us as your personal chief financial officer, right in your pocket. We take the complex world of wealth management and make it straightforward, active, and tailored to you. No more juggling multiple apps or trying to piece together your own investment strategy – we handle everything in one place, with one clear goal: make you more money while saving you more time.
Why do Titan clients choose us?
We’re not your typical wealth manager. We’re building what we wanted but couldn’t find – a wealth manager that combines institutional-grade investing with modern technology and real human expertise, but without the high fees and minimums usually required by other firms. You get our proprietary investment strategies (like our Flagship equity portfolio), smart cash management solutions, and on-demand access to real financial advisors who know their stuff.
But it’s more than just managing money. We’re giving you back your time and peace of mind, plus adding perks you’ll actually use – like free tax filing and access to investment opportunities typically reserved for the ultra-wealthy. We’re not just managing your wealth; we’re helping you build and enjoy it.
How secure is my money with Titan?
Let us be crystal clear about this: Your security is our absolute priority. As an SEC-registered investment adviser, Titan is legally required to act in your best interest as a fiduciary.
SIPC protects investors against the loss of cash and securities⟨17⟩ in the event of a SIPC-member brokerage firm failure. The limit of SIPC coverage is $500,000, which includes a $250,000 limit for cash. SIPC coverage is limited and does not protect against the decline in value of your securities. For more details, visit www.sipc.org.⟨18⟩
Plus, we use a third-party custodian to hold client assets separately. Most importantly, you own all your underlying assets in a separately managed account - we don't hold your assets directly. We employ industry-leading encryption and cybersecurity measures to protect your data, from encryption to SAML protection, because we know we're handling your hard-earned money. That's a responsibility we take incredibly seriously.

**Titan: Your Modern Wealth Management Partner**

Founded in 2018 and hailing from Y Combinator's S18 batch, Titan is a forward-thinking wealth management company based in New York City. With a team of around 50 dedicated professionals, Titan has already made a significant mark in the fintech space, managing over $1 billion in assets and boasting more than 500,000 downloads of its app with a solid 4.6-star rating.

### **The Mission: Managing Wealth for All**

At its core, Titan embodies a simple yet powerful objective: **"We manage people's wealth."** It seeks to bridge the gap between expensive traditional advisors and the DIY investing options that often leave people lost. Titan offers a unique solution by leveraging large language models (LLMs) to provide personalized wealth management—easier, faster, and more cost-effective than ever before.

### **What Makes Titan Different?**

Titan is positioned as a middle ground between do-it-yourself investing and high-fee wealth management. Unlike traditional models that can charge anywhere from 1% to 1.8% per annum, Titan offers their comprehensive services at just a **0.2% advisory fee** per year. This makes professional wealth management accessible to a broader audience.

Their main offerings include:
- **Active Management**: Customized portfolios made from a curated selection of investment strategies across various asset classes, including stocks, ETFs, and treasuries.
- **Personalized Guidance**: Direct access to licensed financial advisors for tailored advice, including investment strategies and tax optimization.
- **Exclusive Perks**: Additional benefits like complimentary tax filing and access to concierge services for unique experiences in major cities.

### **Historical Performance**

Titan's approach has existed since its inception and has shown promising results: their clients have historically compounded their wealth at about **11.6% annually**, outperforming everyday DIY investors by approximately **3%** per year. 

### **Affordability Meets Excellence**

Titan is about making wealth management efficient and effective without draining your resources. Priced at **$25 per month** (or $250 annually), this affordable fee includes not just management services but also tools and insights required for informed investing.

### **Why Choose Titan?**

If you’ve moved beyond basic trading apps and find managing investments a tedious chore, Titan offers a smart alternative. They combine cutting-edge technology with a human touch, making financial management straightforward and accessible. 

With accolades like "Top 10 Investment Firms" by Financial Services Review in 2024 and "Best Financial Advisory Firms" recognition from USA Today in 2023, Titan is not just another financial service; it’s a platform aimed at enriching your financial journey with simplicity and expertise. 

For more information, visit [titan.com](http://www.titan.com).
